pullrequest.title: Use the new multicopter velocity controller for UAVs

pull_request.title: Use the new multicopter velocity controller for UAVs

update.description:
This uses the new velocity controller added in [ign-gazebo PR 487](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/487/). I have only updated X3C5 and X4C6 for now and would like some feedback on the noise characteristics of the two vehicles. With the new controller, the `<ROBOT_NAME>/cmd_vel` topic is actually a velocity topic and can be used to control the linear velocity and the yaw angle velocity of the vehicle. Note that the velocity commands are expressed in the body frame of the vehicle.

The update also exposes a topic `<ROBOT_NAME>/velocity_controller/enable` which can be used to enable/disable the controller. The controller is enabled by default but waits for the first command on the `cmd_vel` topic to do anything. Publishing a `false` would disable the controller and would cause the vehicle to fall.

## To test
First, build ign-gazebo with the PR 487 branch. 

Then launch 
```
ign launch -v 4 urban_circuit.ign robotName1:=R1 robotConfig1:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_5  robotName2:=R2 robotConfig2:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_6 
```
And publish velocity commands
```
rostopic pub /R1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{x: 0.0, z: 0.1}" "{}"
```

```
rostopic pub /R2/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{x: 0.0, z: 0.1}" "{}"
```

To hover, publish
```
rostopic pub /R1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{}" "{}"
```
update.title: Use the new multicopter velocity controller for UAVs

pull_request.title: Use the new multicopter velocity controller for UAVs

pullrequest.title: Use the new multicopter velocity controller for UAVs

content.raw:
The Quad hovers with `rostopic pub /R1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{}" "{}"`, but the Hex doesn’t `rostopic pub /R2/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{}" "{}"`\`

I had to use `rostopic pub /R2/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{x: 0.0, z: 0.1}" "{}"` instead.
content.html:
The Quad hovers with rostopic pub /R1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{}" "{}", but the Hex doesn’t rostopic pub /R2/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{}" "{}"`

I had to use rostopic pub /R2/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{x: 0.0, z: 0.1}" "{}" instead.

content.raw: It was due to a conflict between the old controller and the new. I've removed the old one in adb1b61. I was attempting to have them work side by side, but it wasn't working.
content.html: It was due to a conflict between the old controller and the new. I've removed the old one in adb1b61. I was attempting to have them work side by side, but it wasn't working.

content.raw: hmm when I send the commands, I only see the propeller rotating but the drone does not take off. So I tried commit [7ace976](#!/osrf/subt/commits/7ace97641ce0) and that commit seems to work fine.

pull_request.title: Use the new multicopter velocity controller for UAVs

update.description:
This uses the new velocity controller added in [ign-gazebo PR 487](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/487/). I have only updated X3C5 and X4C6 for now and would like some feedback on the noise characteristics of the two vehicles. With the new controller, the `<ROBOT_NAME>/cmd_vel` topic is actually a velocity topic and can be used to control the linear velocity and the yaw angle velocity of the vehicle. Note that the velocity commands are expressed in the body frame of the vehicle.

The update also exposes a topic `<ROBOT_NAME>/velocity_controller/enable` which can be used to enable/disable the controller. The controller is enabled by default but waits for the first command on the `cmd_vel` topic to do anything. Publishing a `false` would disable the controller and would cause the vehicle to fall.

## To test
First, build ign-gazebo with the PR 487 branch. 

Then launch 
```
ign launch -v 4 urban_circuit.ign robotName1:=R1 robotConfig1:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_5  robotName2:=R2 robotConfig2:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_6 
```
And publish velocity commands
```
rostopic pub /R1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{x: 0.0, z: 0.1}" "{}"
```

```
rostopic pub /R2/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{x: 0.0, z: 0.1}" "{}"
```

To hover, publish
```
rostopic pub /R1/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "{}" "{}"
```
